title: Freedom of Movement | Agnés
description: Agnés, who is French and living in the UK, is a member of the Lush buying team. She tells us what freedom of movement means to her, and how it may be a different story for her and her daughter in the future.

title: Freedom of Movement | Alex
description: Alex, who was born in the UK and whose wife is Finnish, tells us about his experiences of freedom of movement and his worries about how change will affect him and his family in the future.

title: Freedom of Movement | Bart
description: Bart was born in Poland and has lived in the UK for ten years. He now manages the soap department at Lush Manufacturing. Here he tells us how excited he was when Poland first joined the EU in 2004 and his worries about Britain leaving.

title: Freedom of Movement | Anna
description: Anna at Lush Cosmetics, has worked in various countries but lived in France with her French husband and their children. She has since moved back to the UK and worries what Britain leaving the EU will mean for her family.

title: Freedom of Movement | Sandra
description: Sandra was born in Croatia and has been living in the UK with her Welsh husband for eleven years. She worries about the impact that Brexit will have on her husband and daughter in the future when travelling to and from Croatia.

title: Freedom of Movement | Nathalie
description: Nathalie from the buying team, originally born in Germany, has lived in the UK for over ten years. She worries about how this will affect her right to stay in the UK and what this could mean in the future for her daughter who is a British citizen.

title: Freedom of Movement | Alessandro
description: Ale from the brand team, was originally born in Italy but has since worked in Paris, Berlin and London. He regards himself as a global citizen, who has worked hard to contribute to the economy. He finds Britain's move outside of the EU upsetting.

title: The art of social change | Rewrap
description: In a world away from the hustle and bustle of India, artisans, tailors and designers pour their hearts into life at Re-wrap. This non-profit organisation strives for social and environmental change, empowering the women who are proud to be involved.

title: Freedom of Movement | Mark and Simon Constantine
description: Mark and Simon Constantine take to the Summit main stage to discuss freedom of movement and the new "We Believe" statement.

title: East End Walks | David Rosenberg
description: Take a virtual walking tour of London’s Tobacco Docks, an area rich in radical social history, community spirit and activism.

title: The best bits | Lush Summit
description: A glimpse at the speakers, campaigns, new products and music that put the fire in the belly of Lush Summit 2017.

title: Providing for the socially disadvantaged | Artemisszió Foundation
description: Just how do the Artemisszió Foundation from Hungary provide for the unemployed, the Roma, immigrants, and people living in rural areas?

title: Resisting the prison industrial complex | The Empty Cages Collective
description: Hear from The Empty Cages Collective about their aim to build a movement in England, Wales and Scotland to resist the prison industrial complex movement.

title: Justice for women of colour | Black Women Rape Action Project
description: The Black Women Rape Action Project prevents the deportation of rape survivors and highlights the discrimination that women of colour face getting justice.

title: Fighting for love and equality | Matt Beard
description: Matt Beard from All Out talks about fighting for the rights of lesbian, gay, bi and trans people.

title: Digital Rights in the Middle East | Lush Summit
description: From freedom of speech to surveillance, campaigners discuss digital rights in the Middle East, and why the whole world should pay attention.

title: Engage your online community | The Un-Idle Collective
description: Influencers and founders of The Un-Idle Collective - Emma Bates and Scarlett Curtis - are here to help you engage your digital communities.

title: Permaculture in the city | Organic Lea
description: Organic Lea has been teaching permaculture to Londoners for 15 years, so they know a thing or two about the practicalities of growing food in the city.

title: Indigenous rights in the face of climate change | Eriel Tchekwie Deranger
description: Self-described 'professional rabble rouser' Eriel discusses raising awareness about the negative impacts of the extractive industries on climate, human and indigenous rights.

title: The problem with pesticides | Pesticide Action Network
description: Hear from the only UK charity focused on tackling the problems caused by pesticides and promoting safe and sustainable alternatives in agriculture, urban areas, homes and gardens

title: Tackling trapping and animal traders | The Committee Against Birdslaughter
description: Hear from the Committee Against Bird Slaughter, a reactive society that intervenes against the illegal actions of bird trappers, hunters or animal traders in line with current nature protection legislation in Europe.

title: A walking tour of love, life and human rights | Queer Tours of London
description: Take a virtual walking tour of London Docks to learn about the LGBTQIA communities’ incredibly rich history of love, life and the battle for human rights.

title: Making noise in Immigration Removal Centres | Music in Detention
description: In Immigration Removal Centres across the UK, Music in Detention hosts workshops with detainees to improve their well-being and strengthen their cultural identities. We welcomed them to the Lush Summit stage.

title: A woman's place is in the struggle | Radical Women of the East End
description: A woman’s place is in the struggle say Radical Women Of The East End. Here, they tell us why.

title: Songs of protest | Disabled People Against Cuts
description: Disabled People Against Cuts bring their fight of equal rights for disabled people to the Lush Summit. They refuse to stay silent, and they come armed with songs of protest.

title: Supporting transgender children | The Fundación Daniela
description: A chance to hear from Fundación Daniela, an organisation that is working to end the discrimination that the young transgender children and teenagers can suffer.

title: The right to love | Condividilove
description: Italian campaign group Condividilove are asking you to support the rights of sex couples all over the world to love and marry each other.

title: Supporting free speech in Tibet | Banned Expression
description: On the Lush Summit stage, Banned Expression raises awareness of Tibetan rights to freedom of opinion, expression and information.

title: Why we eat what we do | Community Centred Knowledge
description: An interactive discussion looking at why the food we eat is on the menu and relating place to plate.

title: Giving a voice to animals in servitude | Lush Summit
description: Millions of animals are born into slavery. The Animals In Servitude room at the Lush Summit explored some of the ways that animals are used - and the campaigns giving them a voice.

title: How to achieve food sovereignty | Global Justice Now
description: Global Justice Now talk food sovereignty: what it is, how is can be achieved, and why it's an idea worth fighting for.

title: Supporting survivors of human trafficking | Flower Press
description: Flower Press is a social enterprise comprised of survivors of human trafficking and artists. Discover more about their project and watch them at work.

title: Building a progressive Australia | GetUp!
description: GetUp! is an independent movement that's bringing participation back into Australian democracy.

title: Ending suffering on the Mediterranean sea | Sea Watch
description: The EU should be doing more to end the humanitarian crisis, says Sea Watch. But in the meantime, the group are filling the void themselves. They rescued 5,000 people in 2015.

title: Encouraging world leaders to do more | Refugees Welcome
description: Ready to respond to the global crisis and encouraging world leaders to do more, Refugees Welcome take to the Lush Summit stage.

title: Performing live | What They Took With Them
description: Immerse yourself in a spoken-word poem by Jenifer Toksvig, inspired by the first-hand testimonies of refugees.

title: Musical comedy meets humanitarian relief | Dirty Girls of Lesvos
description: The Dirty Girls of Lesvos are pioneering the use of simple environmental practices in humanitarian relief efforts. We welcomed them to the Lush Summit stage.

title: Changing the conversation about refugees | Anat Shenker-Osorio
description: Anat Shenker-Osorio, a communications expert and political pundit, has a few things to say about the way we talk about subjects as far-reaching as immigration and the economy.

title: A musical history of land rights | Three Acres and a Cow
description: Learn of the history of land rights and protest through folk song and story, just like generations did before you.

title: The Women's International League for Peace and Freedom | Sheila Triggs
description: Sheila Triggs from The Women's International League for Peace and Freedom discusses preventing war and ensuring that women are represented at all levels in the peace-building process.

title: The aftermath in the Gaza Strip | #ObliteratedFamilies
description: The #ObliteratedFamilies project, produced by Anne Paq and reporter Ala Qandil, tells the stories of some of the families destroyed by the 2014 Israeli assault on the Gaza Strip.

title: Problems too big to ignore | No Mad Makers
description: When faced with the feeling that the world had big problems - too big to ignore, but too big to do something about - No Mad Makers refused to do nothing.

title: Defending equal access to the internet | Internet Sans Frontières
description: Internet Sans Frontières discuss their activism work and how they are campaigning to prevent the internet from being transformed into a universal means of repression.

title: Is there free expression in the digital world? | Index On Censorship
description: Could a tweet land you in jail? What is “fake news”? Join Index on Censorship to unpick the opportunities and threats that the internet holds for free expression.

title: Performing live | Jackie Oates
description: She's many things, a folk singer, fiddle player, member of The Imagined Village and namesake of a Lush colour supplement, but you’ve not been introduced properly to Jackie until you’ve heard her voice.

title: Saving Europe's environmental laws | Birdlife International
description: The EU's Birds & Habitats Directives recently came under fire from the European Commission. Hear from those campaigning to prevent potential environmental disaster.

title: The controversial art of rewilding | Rewilding Britain
description: Lynx roaming the countryside again... wait, what? Derek Gow and Rebecca Wrigley of Rewilding Britain explain why landscapes must change and how predators can help!

title: Performing live | Duotone
description: Hear from Duotone, the alias of songwriter Barney Morse-Brown who is also cellist with multi-platinum artist Birdy and BBC Folk Award winners the Imagined Village.

title: More than "aid as usual" | The International Rescue Committee
description: The world’s more than 60 million displaced people require more than “aid as usual". The International Rescue Committee has taken on this challenge. Sanj Srikanthan, Deputy Executive Director IRC-UK explains.

title: What lives on the edge of art and activism? | Artivism
description: The Laboratory of Insurrectionary Imagination introduces artivism. Make beautiful trouble irresistible and your direct action more creative and effective.

title: How to spot nuclear propaganda | South West Against Nuclear
description: South West Against Nuclear will help you sort myth from fact in relation to nuclear energy and look at the propaganda you've likely already experienced.

title: Working together against Aviation Expansion | Airport Watch Europe, Frequent Flyers Levy and Plane Stupid
description: Airport Watch Europe, Frequent Flyers Levy and Plane Stupid ask whether we can continue to fly as much as we do.

title: Now is the time to take action | Get Moving for the Climate
description: With a climate denier as US President, a third runway approved at Heathrow and the fossil fuel industry pushing for fracking across the UK, now is the time for action.

title: Envisioning a low carbon future | Centre for Alternative Technology
description: Play card games to compare energy sources, pretend to be an energy minister, and envision a Zero Carbon Britain... all with the Centre for Alternative Technology.

title: Overcoming challenges | Annabelle Baker and Lauren Savage
description: Annabelle Baker and Lauren Savage talk about the challenges and opportunities of operating Lush in another market during turbulent times.

title: Unlock the power of the streets | Street Wisdom
description: Mark Brown introduces the world of Street Wisdom, helping commuters to re-think the art of getting from A to Z.

title: On the fracking frontlines | Nanas Against Fracking
description: Bringing warmth, humour and tea to fracking frontlines across the UK, the Nanas are a group of ordinary people concerned about fracking in the UK.

title: Putting an end to human trafficking | Stop The Traffik
description: Since 2006, Stop The Traffik has been campaigning against trafficking and raising awareness of the crime. Listen to the group explain their work, and discover what you can do to help.

title: Collaboration for users, creators, and activists | Creative Commons
description: Meet the Creative Commons. Their mission: to unlock the full potential of the internet and allow everyone to legally share their knowledge and creativity to build a more equitable, accessible, and innovative world.

title: Blockchain and Bitcoin 101  | Blackfoot
description: You’ve heard of Bitcoin and Blockchain, but what are they? Matt Tyler from Blackfoot explains why secure cryptocurrencies are the future.

title: Can gratitude change your life? | Lush Cosmetics
description: Bryony, Vanessa and Sarah from the Lush learning and development team speak to individuals who recently undertook the '12 Days of Gratitude' challenge.

title: Bold, beautiful frontline folk | Seize the Day
description: Their songs can be both witty and radical, but also hauntingly beautiful. Seize the Day are the "musical voice of the UK's environmental movement" (Satish Kumar).

title: Caring for the Earth and people | May Project Gardens
description: Acclaimed Musicians, MCs, Performers and Activists come together to awaken the eco-conscience through music, song, dance and collaboration.

title: Bath bombs and the future for birds of prey | Chris Packham
description: Naturalist Chris Packham makes his own Skydancer - Far From The Madding Crowd bath bomb and discusses what the future holds for birds of prey across Europe.

title: Q&A | Mark Constantine
description: Join Mark Constantine on his business journey through America, brought to life through comics, books and music.

title: The Movement for Justice By Any Means Necessary | Karen Doyle
description: Karen speaks about The Movement for Justice By Any Means Necessary's commitment to justice, equality and respect.

title: Climate change, migration and displacement | Alex Randall
description: Alex Randall from Climate Outreach explores the warming of our planet and the experiences of people being forced to move.

title: The Snowden Files | Luke Harding and Jo Glanville
description: Luke Harding, Guardian journalist and author of The Snowden Files, takes a seat on the Book Nook sofa with English PEN's Jo Glanville to talk Snowden, online privacy, and the new political landscape.

title: The impact of the Investigatory Powers Act | Panel discussion
description: Hear what campaigners for human and digital rights have to say about the government's Investigatory Powers Act also known as the Snooper's Charter.

title: Reasons to be cheerful in 2017 | John Robb and guests
description: Award-winning journalist John Robb discusses reasons to be cheerful. He's joined by record producer Simon Emmerson, Dream Defenders co-founder Umi Selah, filmmaker Hal Samples, naturalist Chris Packham, Kerry McCarthy MP and musician Grace Petrie.

title: The all-inclusive babe gang | Fierce Babe Network
description: Fierce Babe Network talk about collective power, arranging feel-good events and creating safer spaces for those who are the target of gender oppression.

title: Helping overlooked indigenous communities | Land is Life
description: How can we all help provide direct support to some of the world's most overlooked indigenous communities? Two members of Land is Life from the Phillipines explain.

title: Extreme energy | Frack Off, Biofuel Watch and more
description: Campaigners and activists talk fracking, biofuels and a wave of new extreme energy technologies being rolled out around the world.

title: A Mile in My Shoes | The Empathy Museum
description: When people recommend walking a mile in someone else's shoes, they don't usually mean it literally. Enter The Empathy Museum...

title: Fingers in the Sparkle Jar Q&A | Chris Packham
description: Listen to TV presenter and naturalist Chris discuss his much-lauded memoir Fingers In The Sparkle Jar with long-time birder and podcaster Charlie Moores.

title: Tracking surveillance in the Middle East | Bahrain Watch
description: Bahrain Watch has been at the forefront of confronting digital rights threats in the Gulf, so they shared their experiences at the Lush Summit.

title: Permaculture and the Spring Prize | Simon Constantine
description: Simon Constantine answers questions on food sovereignty and the Spring Prize and discusses how the permaculture movement has affected how Lush does business.

title: Breaking the silence of climate change | George Marshall
description: The co-founder of Climate Outreach talks about the devastating impact our silence on climate change will have and how to start the conversation.

title: Indigenous resistance to fossil fuel extract | UK Tar Sands Network and guests
description: UK Tar Sands Network are joined by Indigenous Climate Action and Seed Indigenous Youth Climate Network to discuss the indigenous resistance to climate change and the importance of international solidarity.

title: How to end the silence on climate change | George Marshall
description: George Marshall has worked with community protest groups, held senior positions in Greenpeace and the Rainforest Foundation, and provided consultancy for governments. Hear him speak about the silence that's holding us all back.

title: Food, farming and nature post-Brexit | A Pebble in the Pond
description: Miles King from new charity People Need Nature talks about their latest report “A Pebble in the Pond”.Join us as we discuss this in detail along with Ariel Brunner, Senior head of EU policy for Birdlife Europe.

title: Protecting the USA's last wild buffalo herd | Buffalo Field Campaign
description: Buffalo Field Campaign (BFC) is the only group working both in the field and in the policy arenas to stop the harassment and slaughter of America’s last wild buffalo.

title: Standing against hatred | Clive Stafford Smith
description: Reprieve are human rights defenders. Founder Clive Stafford Smith speaks about key cases and current issues, particularly the plight of democracy campaigner Andy Tsege, who is currently imprisoned in Ethiopia.

title: A live performance of Karma | Lush Spa
description: Draw up a chair, take a deep breath and let this stunning performance of the new Karma spa treatment soundtrack take you deep into the heart of India...

title: A minority report for the modern age | Umi Selah
description: In this inspiring speech, made at the #LushSummit, community activist and Dream Defenders mission director Umi Selah, raises important points about racism, minorities and human rights in the modern age.

title: Samples of Society: Blackcurrant Angels
description: Samples of Society started out as a project by Hal Samples, who documented the thoughts, ideas and dreams of homeless people. When he introduced the project to Gorilla, the concept of giving the homeless a voice was so powerful that it inspired the V

title: Chris Packham: Connecting with nature
description: TV presenter and naturalist Chris Packham found a connection with nature at a very young age, and has always found solace in wildlife. From the menagerie of wild animals in his childhood bedroom, to his passion for the hen harrier campaign, Chris discusses his passion for natural history.

title: Gorillla Presents Mark & Simon Constantine on Creativity
description: "Where there's friction, there is creativity. It's a process - sparks fly." Join Gorilla perfumers, Mark and Simon Constantine, on their quest for creativity and fresh inspiration.

title: Soapbox Presents a Q&A with Emily James
description: Film director Emily James takes a seat with Lush’s own filmmaker, Erica Edwards. Emily’s film Just Do It is the story behind anti-climate change activism. From legal and financial constraints to hiding film tapes, Emily discusses the difficulties she faced in capturing the stories of the people involved in direct action.

title: THE MUSIC AND BOOK SHOP: David Pearl and Andrew Paine
description: Mixing business with drama may sound like an odd idea, but it’s exactly what David Pearl has been successfully practicing for years. Learn how to make the most of your time and skills by using creative techniques in this lively Q and A.

title: The Kitchen Live with Sleepy Body Lotion
description: Are you sitting comfortably? Snuggle down with an episode of Lush TV and watch as a batch of luxurious Sleepy body lotion is handcrafted by the Kitchen team. Sweet dreams are made of this.

title: Clive Stafford Smith: A matter of life and the death penalty
description:
"Clive Stafford Smith OBE has represented over 400 people on death row. When innocent people have been put to death, he’s come back fighting, and enacted changes in the practice that is still in action in many countries across the world. Clive is the founder and director of Reprieve, an organisation defending human rights. He talks to Lush about the problems with the death penalty, and how to influence change.

Warning: this video contains some upsetting scenes."

title: THE MUSIC AND BOOK SHOP: Mark Howell & Charlie Moores
description: Mark Howell is an author and freelance photographer. His book What Did We Do to Deserve This?: Palestinian Life Under Occupation in the West Bank explores what everyday life is like for Palestinians.

title: The Kitchen Live with Bubbly Shower Gel
description: Countdown to Christmas with the Lush Kitchen compounders as they whip up a festive flute of self-preserving Bubbly shower gel.

title: The Kitchen Live with Henna
description: Are you henna-curious? Tune into haircare 101 with Lush co-founders, Mark Constantine and Rowena Bird, for all the hair colour highlights.

title: THE MUSIC AND BOOK SHOP: Vandana Shiva and Matt Shaw
description: Environmental activist Dr Vandana Shiva talks about her new book Who Really Feeds The World?, as well as diversity, biodiversity, and permaculture of the mind, in this captivating Q&A.

title: A Soapbox film with Solidarity With Refugees
description: Meet Rosalind Ereira, whose idea of a march in solidarity with refugees grew into something powerful.

title: THE MUSIC AND BOOK SHOP: Mark Pilkington and Matt Fairhall
description: Mark Pilkington is a writer, publisher and exhibition curator with an interest in topics that fall outside of the norms of knowledge, culture and belief. Find out more about his encounters in the weird, wonderful, and sometimes scary world of UFOria

title: Soapbox Presents Dr Vandana Shiva
description: Inspired by the bounty of nature, Dr Vandana Shiva discusses her passion for sustainable agriculture, and her involvement with bringing to an end the “age of chemical poisons.” Vandana shares wisdom from her life as an ecological activist, and argues that organic farming and working with the Earth are the way forward.

title: Soapbox Presents Wafa Ben Hassine
description: "Digital rights are human rights. The same rights you have as a human being existing in flesh and bones should exist in bytes and bandwidth." Wafa Ben Hassine from Access Now talks about the frightening reality of internet shutdowns.

title: Soapbox Presents a Q&A with Giacomo Giorgi
description:
"Giacomo Giorgi takes to the Lush Creative Showcase stage to discuss his documentary, On the Wild Side - a film about hunting, and the people working to bring it to an end.

Lush ethics director Hilary Jones asks Giacomo about filmmaking, life as an activist, and what drove him to make the film."

title: Lush Times Presents John McDonnell
description: Get Stuck In! That’s the advice of John McDonnell, Shadow Chancellor to the Exchequer and Jeremy Corbyn’s right-hand man. Watch as he addresses audiences at the Lush Creative Showcase on Post-Brexit politics and how to instigate meaningful change.

title: The Fox Project
description: The Fox Project works with over 7,000 foxes a year, helping them get fit and back out in the wild. Founder Sue Williams explains how The Fox Project came about, and why working to protect these misunderstood animals is so rewarding.

title: Soapbox Presents a Q&A with Amir Amirani
description:
Amir Amirani, director of We Are Many and Maya Evans, a prominent campaigner from Voices for Creative Nonviolence, take a seat on the Lush Creative Showcase stage with Carlene Pickard from Lush North America. 

Amir and Maya are fuelled by the powerful message of the 2003 global march against the war in Iraq. They discuss finding a voice within our democracy, and what it is that will make political leaders sit up and listen.

title: The Kitchen Live with the Ballistics
description: If you can't stand the heat, get out of the Kitchen! Watch the highlights instead as the team sift, mix and press a batch of Never Mind The Ballistics bath bomb.

title: Lush Kitchen Presents: Witchin' Kitchen
description: Get your brave face on folks... the Lush Kitchen's Halloween-themed livescream has emerged from the depths; it's Witchin' Kitchen y'all!

title: Marine Connection
description:
"All dolphins and whales should be wild and free.”

Marine Connection are introducing people around the world to the idea of keeping dolphins and whales free from captivity. Born from a desire to make a difference to the lives of dolphins and whales, their work spans across the globe

title: The Kitchen Live with the Bath Bombs, Jack, Monami and Gabriella
description: Join digital director and product inventor, Jack Constantine, as he whips up a batch of bathing delights with lifestyle vlogger, Monami Frost, who's joined by her daughter.

title: The Kitchen Live with Snowie Bubble Bar
description: Hey, good looking, what ya got cooking? Tune in to watch the Lush Kitchen compounders create a flurry of shimmery Snowie bubble bars.

title: Soapbox Presents a Q&A with Susi Bascon
description:
"Director of Peace Brigade International (PBI) UK, Susi Bascon, explains the vital role of volunteers, and the organisation’s relationship with Lush.

PBI volunteers provide an international presence to human rights defenders and peace communities across the world. They take a year out of their lives to help others stand up for peace, in places like Communidad de Paz (Peace Community) de San José de Apartadó, Colombia, where Fair Trade organic cocoa butter is produced."

title: Lush Kitchen Presents: 'Time Well Scent'
description: You and me, we're scent to be! Gaze through the lens as we launch into the evocative new world of Gorilla Volume 4.
